title: Week 2: January 5–11 - Moses 1; Abraham 3
content:
# Come, Follow Me for Kids: Week 2 (Jan 5–11)  
**Moses 1; Abraham 3**  
*You are a child of God with a special work to do! Let's discover God's love together.*

## Fun Start  
Imagine looking in a mirror and hearing God say, "You are my child!" (Moses 1:4). What would that make you feel? This week, we'll learn we are God's children who lived with Him before earth!

## Key Gospel Ideas  
1. **I am a child of God!** God told Moses, "Thou art my son" (Moses 1:4, 6). *Color pictures of children saying, "I am a child of God!" Younger kids: Simple faces. Older: Add families.*  
2. **I can resist Satan with God's help.** Moses said "Get thee hence, Satan" and called on God (Moses 1:20–22, 26). *Draw God’s strong words vs. Satan’s sneaky ones (Moses 1:4, 12).*  
3. **Heavenly Father has work for me!** God said to Moses, "This is my work and my glory—to bring to pass the immortality and eternal life of man" (Moses 1:39). *Color Moses seeing God's creations.*  
4. **I lived as a spirit before earth.** "Ye were … in the beginning with the heavens and the earth … intelligence … organized before the world" (Abraham 3:22). *Draw happy spirits choosing to come to earth.*  
5. **I can follow God's plan.** Find words like "spirits," "prove," "make an earth" (Abraham 3:22–28). Sing "I Will Follow God’s Plan" (Children’s Songbook, 164–65)!

## Daily Adventures  
- **Day 1:** Look in a mirror and say, "I am a child of God" (Moses 1:4). Hug family! (Younger: Repeat with mom. Older: Say why.)  
- **Day 2:** Sing "I Am a Child of God" (Hymns, no. 301). Draw your divine self!  
- **Day 3:** Act out Moses telling Satan "Get thee hence" (Moses 1:20). Practice saying no to bad choices.  
- **Day 4:** Read Moses 1:39. Build earth with playdough—God's work!  
- **Day 5:** Circle "before the world was" in Abraham 3:22. Draw premortal spirits.  
- **Day 6:** Sing "I Will Follow God’s Plan." Practice choices to "prove" ourselves (Abraham 3:25).  
- **Day 7:** Share work God has for you, like Moses (Moses 1:6). Family prayer of thanks!

## Story Time (248 words)  
Once, God called righteous Moses to a high mountain. God showed Moses the earth and all His creations—worlds without number! "Worlds have I created," God said (Moses 1:33). Moses saw God's glory and knew, "Now I know that man is nothing" (Moses 1:10).  

God hugged Moses with His love: "Thou art my son; wherefore look … for world is mine" (Moses 1:4, 6). Moses was filled with joy!  

Then Satan came, sneaky and mad: "Moses, son of man, worship me" (Moses 1:12). Moses said no! "Who art thou? … I am a son of God, in the similitude of his Only Begotten" (Moses 1:13, 16). Satan got fierce, but Moses called, "In the name of the Only Begotten, depart!" (Moses 1:21). Angels came, and Satan left (Moses 1:26).  

God returned: "This is my work … eternal life of man" (Moses 1:39). Later, Abraham saw spirits before earth: "These I will make my rulers … Abraham, thou art one of them" (Abraham 3:22–23). We chose to come prove ourselves!  

*Questions:* How did God make Moses feel special (Moses 1:4)? What did Moses say to Satan (Moses 1:20)? Why did we come to earth (Abraham 3:25)? (Younger: Point and repeat. Older: Share feelings.)

## Play and Learn  
1. **Mirror Messages:** Say "You are a child of God" to reflections or pictures (Moses 1:4). Switch turns! (Younger: Just look/smile. Older: Compare to Satan's lie, Moses 1:12.)  
2. **Resist Temptation Act-Out:** Pretend Satan's tricks; kids say "Get thee hence!" and pray (Moses 1:12–26). Use blocks as mountains.  
3. **Premortal Puzzle:** Hide words "spirits," "prove" (Abraham 3:22–28). Find and draw. Sing song after!  
4. **God's Work Builders:** Stack blocks as "worlds" (Moses 1:33). Talk Heavenly Father's plan (Moses 1:39). (Primary class fun!)

## Jesus Connection  
Jesus is God's Only Begotten—He helps bring eternal life (Moses 1:39)! He was chosen before earth to help us (Abraham 3:22–28). Pray: "Thank You, Jesus, for loving me as God's child." I know Jesus helps us follow the plan—He makes it possible! (Younger: Simple thanks. Older: Share a time He helped.)  

*(512 words)*
